items.title: The best earbuds we’ve tested for 2025
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- The market for *wireless earbuds* has evolved significantly, with brands like **Sony**, **Apple**, and **Bose** leading in performance and features. 
- Buyers should consider factors such as **noise cancellation**, **sound quality**, and **comfort** when choosing the right pair for their needs. 
- Products like the **Sony WF-1000XM5** and **Bose QuietComfort Ultra Earbuds** are highlighted for their exceptional performance in various categories.

items.title: AI for Emotional Support During Layoffs: Xbox Exec's Advice
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
*Microsoft's recent layoffs impact its gaming studios.*  
*Xbox's Matt Turnbull suggests using AI chatbots for career guidance and emotional support.*  
*Opinions on AI's role in job loss are divided, but it may offer helpful resources in tough times.*

items.title: The Ploopy Knob: Open-Source Control Dial
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The **Ploopy Knob** is designed for easy control of various computer functions like volume and media scrolling. 
- It is available for **$49.99 CAD**, unlike other Ploopy products that are DIY kits, this one comes fully assembled. 
- Powered by a **Raspberry Pi** microcontroller, it utilizes open-source **QMK firmware** for seamless performance, especially on Windows and Linux.

items.title: The Best Bluetooth Trackers for Apple and Android Phones
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Bluetooth trackers are essential for those who frequently misplace items, offering features like precision tracking and large network integration for easier item recovery.
- AirTags and Tile products stand out for iPhone and Android users, respectively, with unique capabilities and support for broader networks like Find My.
- While trackers enhance convenience, they also raise privacy concerns, necessitating the importance of anti-stalking features and user education.

items.title: The American system of democracy has crashed
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- The article discusses the historical significance of the Declaration of Independence and its assertion of *unalienable rights* of the people, which are now questioned under contemporary governance.
- It critiques the actions of the Trump administration, highlighting issues such as *extra-legal deportations* and the disregard for due process as signs of a *democratic crisis*.
- The Supreme Court's recent rulings are portrayed as an abdication of its duty, enabling unchecked presidential power and undermining constitutional guarantees.

items.title: This is not a tattoo robot
items.author: Mack DeGeurin
items.summary:
- The Blackdot device is being touted as the world’s *first automatic tattooing device*, creating tattoos with high precision and utilizing a proprietary process.  
- It operates under human supervision and is designed for intricate designs, but currently faces limitations regarding tattoo styles and body areas it can work on.  
- Despite initial skepticism within the tattoo community, *clients report positive outcomes*, including reduced pain during the tattooing process.

items.title: New Galaxy Z Fold 7 leaks may give first real look at Samsung’s slimmer foldable
items.author: Jess Weatherbed

items.title: Fairphone 6 Achieves Perfect Repairability Score
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- The *Fairphone 6* has received a **10/10** on repairability from *iFixit*, showcasing its modular design. 
- Only a T5 Torx screwdriver is needed for repairs, allowing easy access to most components. 
- It also features a commitment to long-term software support with *seven years of Android updates* and an *eight-year security patch life*.

items.title: The Loop Micro: A Top Bicycle Phone Mount
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- The **Loop Micro Mount** is discreet, securely holds phones on all terrain, and is easy to install. 
- It supports various phone sizes and orientations but requires two hands for mounting. 
- While designed primarily for road use, concerns exist regarding its durability under harsh weather conditions.

items.title: Slate Auto’s electric pickup price rises above $20,000
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- Slate Auto’s electric pickup is now priced in the *mid-twenties* after the repeal of federal EV tax credits. 
- This change comes as Trump signs legislation that ends a crucial $7,500 tax incentive. 
- The previous under $20,000 price tag was a significant selling point, now adjusted due to policy alterations.

items.title: The White House’s favorite source of pro-Trump news is … the White House’s YouTube channel
The best robot vacuum and mop to buy right now
Nintendo Switch 2 Dock Supports VRR, But Not for the Console
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- The *Nintendo Switch 2* dock *supports variable refresh rate (VRR)*, confirmed by testing with rival handhelds. 
- Despite supporting VRR in handheld mode, Nintendo **omitted TV support** for the docked mode and apologized for the miscommunication. 
- Technical issues in the Switch 2's performance, especially in *gameplay and framerates*, raise questions about the console's readiness for VRR on larger screens.

items.title: Letters That Helped Keep TikTok Online
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- A **FOIA** request revealed letters from the US DOJ to tech companies about TikTok's legal status.
- Attorney General Pam Bondi assured companies they would not face penalties for violating a law banning TikTok.
- The letters aimed to alleviate concerns over national security linked to TikTok's Chinese ownership by ByteDance.

items.title: Meet Soham Parekh: A Startup Controversy
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- *Soham Parekh*, a software engineer, is rumored to work at multiple startups simultaneously, leading to controversy in the tech community.
- Founders have raised concerns over Parekh's job history, with some sharing experiences of him holding multiple positions without disclosure.
- Despite the turmoil, Parekh claims to have a new role at *Darwin*, suggesting potential redemption in his career after a challenging period.

items.title: Congress Passes Budget for Deportations, Social Service Cuts
items.author: Adi Robertson
items.summary:
- The Republican-controlled Congress passed a budget prioritizing *funding for ICE* and *mass deportations* while cutting *Medicaid* and *social services*.
- The bill makes it more difficult for *clean energy* initiatives to thrive, particularly through reductions in *tax credits* for renewable energy.
- Critics, including some Republicans, express concerns over the impact on healthcare and the reliance on *corporate tax cuts* benefiting the wealthy.

items.title: The best laptops you can get
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary:
- The *MacBook Air M4* is recommended as the best laptop for most users due to its excellent battery life and performance. 
- For specialized needs like gaming or creative tasks, alternatives like the *MacBook Pro* or unique models may be necessary. 
- Key features to look for include a strong build, quality keyboard and trackpad, good display, and robust battery life.

items.title: Top Robot Vacuum Deals for Prime Day
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Get the *best early robot vacuum deals* ahead of Prime Day starting July 8th. 
- Featured deals include *Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra* for $999.99, boasting 10,000Pa suction and advanced navigation features. 
- Affordable alternatives are available as well, like the *Yeedi vacuum* and *Dreame models*, ensuring quality cleaning options for every budget.

items.title: E Ink's Innovative Touchpad for AI Apps
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- *E Ink* introduces a touchpad for laptops that utilizes e-paper technology aimed at enhancing AI application interaction.
- This touchpad is envisioned as a separate workspace for AI tools, displaying text summaries and facilitating chatbot interactions.
- E Ink technology conserves power as it only activates during updates, benefiting laptop battery life, particularly when using demanding AI applications.

items.title: Paramount Plus Offers $2 for Two Months
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- *Paramount Plus* is offering new subscribers a summer deal of $0.99/month for two months for both its Premium and Essential plans.
- This promotion includes access to popular shows like *Star Trek* and *Yellowstone*, along with premium features such as ad-free streaming and offline downloads.
- After the promotional period, standard rates will resume at $12.99 for Premium and $7.99 for Essential, so users should remember to cancel if they don't want to continue.

items.title: Apple’s Colorful Watch Solo Loop Bands Discounted
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The *Solo Loop band* is now just *$14.99*, down from $49, offering a wide range of colors and sizes.
- *Braided Solo Loop bands* are also available for *$29.99*, combining aesthetics with breathability for workouts.
- These discounts represent up to *70% off*, making it a perfect time to add more options for your Apple Watch.

items.title: The best phone to buy right now
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Current phones prioritize *familiarity* and *functional improvements* over groundbreaking innovations.
- Recommended devices ensure *long-term updates*, advanced camera features, and durable designs.
- Options cater to a range of budgets, including excellent choices for under **$600**.

items.title: Deerhoof Withdraws from Spotify over Ethical Concerns
items.author: Elizabeth Lopatto
items.summary:
- **Deerhoof** announced its decision to remove music from *Spotify* due to ethical concerns over Daniel Ek's investment in AI military technology firm, Helsing.
- The band, traditionally critical of Spotify's low payouts and practices, cited *mental health* and moral grounds for their quick decision.
- They encourage other artists to consider boycotting Spotify and *social media* platforms like Instagram, aiming for a *movement* against perceived exploitation and war profiteering.

items.title: Best Streaming Service Deals Right Now
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Numerous *streaming services* are running *promotions* for new and returning subscribers. 
- Look out for *free trials* and *student discounts* across platforms like Hulu and Disney Plus. 
- Offers vary significantly depending on service, with platforms like Sling TV providing competitive pricing for live TV streaming.

items.title: Whoop MG review: a big whoop for a small crowd
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- The Whoop MG fitness tracker offers *hardware upgrades* like faster processing, smaller size, improved 14-day battery life, and added EKG and blood pressure features but retains *some annoyances* such as the fiddly clasp and non-backward-compatible straps.
- The revamped *subscription model* features three tiers with variable features and pricing, aiming to appeal to more users, though the $199 minimum subscription remains a consideration amid *subscriber fatigue*.
- New software features like Healthspan, Whoop Age, and AI coaching provide insights into *sleep, recovery, and strain*, but some metrics (e.g., aging score) and AI advice feel *overly simplistic* or not fully reflective of complex health factors.

items.title: Helldivers 2 is the first PlayStation-published Xbox game
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary: - *Helldivers 2* will launch on Xbox Series X and S on August 26th for $39.99, marking the first PlayStation-published game on Xbox with cross-play support. - The game is a popular cooperative PvE third-person shooter known for its mix of serious sci-fi and humorous moments, featuring a complex Strategem system and evolving live-service lore. - Unlike the initial PC launch's PSN login requirement, the Xbox version likely won't require it, enhancing accessibility for players across platforms.

items.title: The best deals on MacBooks right now
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- Apple MacBooks with M-series chips are available across a range of models, with significant discounts on older versions like the M1 MacBook Air now starting at $649 at Walmart. 
- The latest MacBook Air models from M2, M3, and M4 chips offer improvements in performance, battery life, and features like MagSafe charging and dual display support, with current discounts ranging from $150 to $350. 
- Refurbished Apple MacBooks provide another cost-effective option with up to 20% off and a one-year warranty, while newer M3 and M4 MacBook Pro models are beginning to see discounts but the last-gen M3 models often offer better bargains.

items.title: Lego’s Latest Arcade Machine Offers Fun Hidden Details
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- The new Lego Arcade Machine set contains 468 pieces and sells for $39.99, launching August 1st, 2025.  
- Though non-playable, it features a generic space game and reveals a hidden gaming room with tiny consoles, a sofa, TV, and a smaller buildable arcade machine.  
- The set includes references to other Lego lines and features a functional coin slot and printed tiles simulating the arcade screen and marquee.

items.title: Adding calendar events with a screenshot is AI at its finest
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- *iOS 26* introduces a new feature: add events to your *calendar* using just a *screenshot*.
- The feature, leveraging *Visual Intelligence*, accurately identifies event details and streamlines calendar management.
- Compared to previous and Android-based methods, this AI-powered tool offers increased *accuracy* and *convenience*, especially for users who struggle with calendar organization.

**Scores:** {"scale": 8, "impact": 7, "novelty": 8, "longTermSignificance": 7}
**Keywords:** [AI, iOS, Calendar, Visual Intelligence, Productivity, Smartphone Features]

items.title: The latest One UI 8 update leaks Samsung’s trifold phone design
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Samsung's upcoming trifolding flagship, possibly named *Galaxy G Fold*, was leaked through animations in the *One UI 8* update, revealing a three-panel device with a dual-hinge mechanism and triple-camera setup.
- The *design* features two differently-sized hinges with specific folding instructions to avoid damage, differing from Huawei's Mate XT with its Z-shaped fold.
- Official details are scarce, but more information may arise at Samsung's upcoming *Unpacked* event on July 9th, alongside new Z Fold and Z Flip devices.

items.title: RFK Jr.’s plan to put ‘AI’ in everything is a disaster
items.author: Lauren Leffer
items.summary: - RFK Jr. claims an "AI revolution" is happening at the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, promoting AI for drug approvals and vaccine data analysis but demonstrating a poor understanding of AI capabilities. - He plans to overhaul VAERS with AI, risking misinterpretation and misuse of vaccine safety data, potentially fueling misinformation and public distrust. - Experts warn that AI systems depend heavily on data quality and intent, and under Kennedy's leadership, AI could be manipulated to support anti-vaccine agendas, threatening public health efforts.

items.title: A Guide to the Best Sci-Fi Streaming This Summer
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- This summer offers a rich lineup of *science fiction streaming*, with highlights including Apple TV Plus's *Murderbot* and *Foundation* season 3, Disney Plus's *Ironheart*, MGM Plus's *The Institute*, and Paramount Plus's *Star Trek: Strange New Worlds* season 3.  
- The season features a mix of styles, from *existential androids* to superhero tales, alien invasions, and explorations of *afrofuturism* in Marvel's *Eyes of Wakanda*.  
- New releases such as *Alien: Earth* on Hulu/FX and *Invasion* season 3 on Apple TV Plus promise escalating action and thrilling storylines, perfect for fans to binge during summer.

items.title: Google’s customizable Gemini chatbots are now in Docs, Sheets, and Gmail
items.author: Jess Weatherbed

items.title: The best Apple deals you can shop ahead of Amazon Prime Day
items.author: Sheena Vasani

items.title: Racist AI Videos Go Viral on TikTok
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- *AI-generated videos* using Google’s Veo 3 are spreading rapidly on TikTok, garnering millions of views.
- These clips contain *racist tropes* targeting Black people, with some videos reaching over 14 million views.
- Despite Google’s claims to block harmful requests, the presence of *was also found* on YouTube and Instagram, raising concerns about *content moderation* and *platform responsibility*.

items.title: Blizzard Winds Down Support for Warcraft Mobile Game
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: - Blizzard is ceasing new content development for its mobile game *Warcraft Rumble* due to challenges in achieving sustainability and player retention. - The game will continue to receive bug fixes and in-game events but no major updates, joining other Blizzard titles like *Starcraft II* and *Heroes of the Storm* in stasis. - These changes come amid ongoing Microsoft layoffs impacting Blizzard and related project cancellations such as *Everwild* and *Perfect Dark* remake.

items.title: Google’s fix for Pixel 6A battery overheating issues arrives next week
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- Google is rolling out a mandatory **Android 16 update** starting July 8 to address *battery overheating* on affected Pixel 6A phones.
- The update reduces battery capacity after 400 charge cycles and notifies users at 375 cycles, potentially shortening battery life between charges.
- *Free battery replacements* are available for impacted devices, continuing Google's approach to prior Pixel battery issues.

items.title: Xbox hit hard with layoffs: from cancelled games to a shuttered studio
items.author: Verge Staff

items.title: How Nintendo locked down the Switch 2’s USB-C port and broke third-party docking
items.author: Sean Hollister

items.title: Phil Spencer isn’t retiring as the chief of Xbox ‘anytime soon’
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - Microsoft confirms that *Phil Spencer*, CEO of Microsoft Gaming and head of Xbox, is **not retiring anytime soon**, denying recent retirement rumors. - Spencer has led Xbox since 2014, overseeing major initiatives including Xbox Series X/S, Game Pass expansion, and acquisitions such as *Activision Blizzard* and *ZeniMax Media*. - Despite his tenure, Microsoft is continuing layoffs affecting Xbox studios, cancelling projects like *Perfect Dark* and *Everwild*, and reducing staff at Turn 10 Studios and Zenimax Online.

items.title: Zelle needs to fix ‘significant scams and fraud,’ lawmakers say
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
*Lawmakers are pressuring major banks to address widespread fraud on Zelle,* a peer-to-peer payment platform.

*They seek information on scam trends, especially from social media, and policies on customer reimbursement.*

*Recent legal actions and bank measures highlight ongoing concerns about protecting consumers from Zelle scams.*

items.title: Here are 25 of our favorite deals from Amazon’s early Prime Day sale
Three former Ubisoft executives convicted of harassment
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
* Three ex-Ubisoft executives, Serge Hascoet, Tommy Francois, and Guillaume Patrux, received fines and suspended sentences for sexual and psychological harassment.
* Incidents included inappropriate comments, attempted sexual assault, and aggressive behavior in the workplace, sparked by a long investigation beginning in 2020.
* The case highlights longstanding issues of misconduct within Ubisoft, with some executives blaming company culture for their actions.

items.title: Amazon offers refurbished Kindle Paperwhite 2024 for $107
items.author: Brandon Russell
items.summary: *The refurbished Kindle Paperwhite 2024 is now just $107, a like-new deal* at Amazon, marking an all-time low. *Features include a 7-inch display, waterproof design, and a battery life of up to 12 weeks*, making it ideal for avid readers. *Faster performance is ensured with a dual-core processor, and thorough inspections guarantee quality, backed by a one-year warranty.*

items.title: Crunchyroll’s AI-generated subtitles for new anime spark backlash
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Crunchyroll used *ChatGPT-generated subtitles* for the new anime *Necronomico and the Cosmic Horror Show*, resulting in numerous typos and errors that worsened the viewing experience.  
- This contradicts Crunchyroll president Rahul Purini’s previous claims that AI would not be used in the creative process or to affect voice actors.  
- The incident highlights the essential role of *human translators* and the risks of rushing generative AI adoption in entertainment, undermining authenticity and quality.

items.title: Neil Druckmann Leaves HBO 'The Last of Us' Series
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- *Neil Druckmann*, co-creator of the *The Last of Us* game and co-showrunner, will step back from the HBO adaptation.
- His decision allows him to focus on *Naughty Dog's* upcoming projects, including the next game, *Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet*.
- Druckmann's involvement was key to the series' close adherence to the *original material* and he also contributed to major *Naughty Dog* titles like *Uncharted 4*.

items.title: The best iPad deals you can get right now
Microsoft cancels Perfect Dark and Everwild Xbox games
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is canceling the *Perfect Dark* and *Everwild* games and closing The Initiative studio as part of major Xbox division cuts.
- These moves coincide with layoffs of around *9,000 employees* across Microsoft and hits to other studios like Turn 10 behind *Forza Motorsport*.
- Xbox commits to prioritizing its portfolio with 40+ active projects and support for affected employees through severance and career assistance.

items.title: Microsoft's Forza Motorsport Developer Hit Hard by Xbox Cuts
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- *Microsoft announced layoffs* affecting up to 9,000 employees, with *over 70 layoffs at Turn 10 Studios*, the Forza Motorsport developer.  
- Several major Xbox projects are canceled, including *Rare's Everwild*, a new *Zenimax MMORPG*, and the *new Perfect Dark game*.  
- Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer cites *strategic reprioritization and increased agility* as reasons, with past studio closures also part of this shift.

items.title: Lorde’s new CD is so transparent that stereos can’t even read it
